article.title: U.S. Navy Orders Survivor Evader Locator Radio Sets
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: The Boeing Company, Lanham, Maryland, is being awarded about $8 million for a firm-fixed-price order via the General Services Administration (GSA) schedule for the procurement of 964 Combat Survivor Evader Locator System handheld radio sets that will provide multiple communication options for search and rescue missions. In addition, this contract also provides for 1,928 rechargeable batteries and 80 radio set adapters. The Naval Air Systems Command, Patuxent River, Maryland, is the contracting activity.
